Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Garry C
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for a 3 day short break for my sister, brother-in-law, my wife and myself. All of us were very impressed with the amenities in the hotel, the location but more importantly the staff. They were very welcoming, helpful, friendly and really made our stay very special. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends, family because it is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great staff, great choice!”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc
Reviews.Content: When you look at a map of Paris, this hotel is perfectly centered. It is close to all the major destinations. PROS: * We could easily walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, and most other great destinations. The Eiffel Tower was a longer walk, but easy enough, and a beautiful path. * The hotel is in a safe and convenient area. * It is quiet. * The people working there are very (very) good at making useful suggestions of things to do, places to go, places to eat, and directions. They were patient and seemed happy to help, despite our many questions. * it is clean, there is a mini fridge, tea service in the rooms. * I thought the charges were very fair for this location in Paris. CONS: * The rooms are smaller than Americans are accustomed to (I am guessing this is typical of Paris, and it was not a hardship - we were very happy here). * That is it - this is a great choice, and while not pretentious, they go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable --and ours was!

Reviews.Title: “A small but excellent hotel located in the centre of Paris with a very polite and competent service team.”
Reviews.Author: muekrue
Reviews.Content: optimal location, clean and comfortable rooms (rooms in the backyard are small), very polite service personal, excellent and rich breakfast, free WLAN - For my next visit I would take the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “SpanishTravellers”
Reviews.Author: SpanishTraveller248
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a four day stay after reading the customer reviews but really didn´t know what to expect. We now feel very glad for our choice. We booked a large double room , not luxurious but very cosy and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was not big but everything was new and worked perfectly. Nice toiletries too. It was comforting to have facilities for preparing hot drinks on our return after a cold and tiring day in the city. The location was also great, within walking distance to the main attractions and just a short walk to Opera , with lots of shops and restaurants around. We are very greatful to all the staff, who were very friendly and always ready to help with recommendations of restaurants ,transport to airport, etc. The biggest inconvenience was the lift, too small but this is something normal in Paris. On the whole, very good value compared to other hotels in the same area.. We will definitely go back to this hotel on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel that I would and did, return to.”
Reviews.Author: HappiTravelerChicago
Reviews.Content: We just walked in off the street and did get a nice room, It had a balcony that looked onto the street. It was a 2 minute walk to the subway, 5 minute to the Opera, and just a few more minutes to the Louvre and Rue Rivoli. The rooms weren't huge but weren't all that small. Ours had a bed, sofa, desk, tv, armoire and a nice modern bathroom. Staff was very nice and fluent in english. Elevator super small. Only one person with luggage can go up at a time. Two people without luggage is quite intimitate. We were heading back to Paris on our way out and showed up without reservations to get another room. They were booked full but called around and got us another room nearby which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly experience in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Matkatin
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to many central attractions, still on a very quiet street. Extremely friendly welcome service, and friendly smiles throughout the stay. Cosy rooms, good for Paris. Breakfast typical and ok. Good value for money, would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Anwesha H
Reviews.Content: The location of this place was excellent and we really enjoyed our stay. However the rooms are really small and when I say small I mean matchbox sized. There is not enough place to move around. But it is right next to the sub station and I mean right next to it. There is a really nice Indian restaurant right next to this hotel as well. Having said all this for some reason this place gave me the creeps at night. If you are not one of those who believes in all this then this place is definitely your money's worth :) I would have given it an excellent rating but for the creeps.

Reviews.Title: “friendly central location”
Reviews.Author: scots_in_india
Reviews.Content: good breakfast, relaxing place to stay, and nice walks around all the central sights

Reviews.Title: “Very nice quintessential Parisean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JohnR92656
Reviews.Content: Not a four star but very nice, clean and located near the Louvre. Pros - A/C, Window in the bathroom that opens, nice view from the balcony, near tons of shops and cafes, metro station is a two minute walk, good blowdryer in the bathroom and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Cons - rooms are tiny, bathroom is tiny and has no shower curtain, no iron, elevator is TINY!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JanesBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Service from the front desk was great on arrival but after that wwas poor. The hotel itself was clean and well located. Close to attractions (espeically the Louvre), metro stations and eating places and we were able to walk most places. We had a trip room - good size for 3 adults (not very roomy but suitable) and bathroom was a good size. Very comfortable stay.WE did not pay for breakfast...plenty of places close by and cheaper. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: SanderCools
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 days nights in the hotel and we really enjoyed it. Opera and the Louvre in short walkingdistance. Subwaystations nearby. The room was small, so a normal room in Paris. Comfortable bed and actually a big shower for in Paris. The hotelstaff was amazing, always friendly and helpfull. And they knew yo personally as soon you entered the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: liverbird83
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Excellent location, about 5-10 min walk to the Louvre. Its just off a main road so quiet enough for an excellent nights sleep. Bed and rooms very clean. Will definately be staying here again when we return to this amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, and well located. Be careful of your room location!!”
Reviews.Author: WinstonIII
Reviews.Content: My wife & I were looking for a well-located, small & affordable hotel in the heart of Paris. After doing our research, we booked at the Hotel Lourvre Marsollier Opera. At our arrival, we thought we'd be happy with the location and appearance of the hotel. The young associate at the front desk was gracious and welcoming...he gave us the key to our room located on the floor on the front of the building, facing the street. The room was acceptable and reasonably clean with a comfortable bed, desk, day bed and large dresser in which to store & hang our clothes. The bath was small, but clean. We slept well the first night until we were awakened at 7AM by very loud workers and trucks banging. This occurred every morning. It was loud and unexpected!! Being early risers, it was not a deal breaker for us, but beware. The service desk associates were polite and helpful, but you need to ask for anything you need, and they will provide service, mostly for local directions & maps.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: jimsGreenville_SC
Reviews.Content: As one of 3 middle aged traveling couples, we got lucky picking this small hotel in a very quiet square. Only a 10 minute walk from both the Louvre and Notre Dame, only a block from great restaurants and very expensive hotels. Staff was English speaking and very helpful. If lucky enough to go to Paris again, I would stay here. For 140 euros per night, a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Never again! They overbook, dont arrive late”
Reviews.Author: Quini400
Reviews.Content: I arrived Paris at 20:30 on Friday. Just arrived the hotel and the recepcionist tell me that due to overbooking issues they had rebooked me on other hotel of the sorroundings. No previous phone call, no warning, no email, The hotel provided was horrible and dirty Hotel Choiseul and they applied me the same fare. Hope this is not the kind that travellers get in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great location and perfect service in a comfy, squeaky clean, little room.”
Reviews.Author: Egg_bnl
Reviews.Content: Right between 3 metro stations and at walking distance to the Opera in one way, the Louvre and the Place Vendome on the other way, this hidden hotel made our trip to Paris that much better. Its tiny room and elevator makes the experience cozier and fun. The staff is fluent in 2 or 3 languages, which is convenient if you don't speak French, and they are increadibly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Well located decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Recoleta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room (couple + 2 babies). Everything was quite small - the room, the doorway, the elevator. We had to leave the strollers downstairs. The location is good and things are clean, etc. We did not try the breakfast. The front desk people were not very helpful in general.

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGATABLE STAY IN THE HEART OF PARIS”
Reviews.Author: ELMIChamblyOise
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reception is very nice, efficiant, friendly but very professionnal. Hotel ideally situated in the center of Paris in a very quiet street, a few steps from "opera" and underground stations. Our bedroom was on the last floor, clean, nice, small but confortable with a very nice view on the Sacré-coeur. Ideal room for a romantic stay. Large choice of continental breakfast served in a cosy restaurant room

Reviews.Title: “Beautyfull”
Reviews.Author: Frenc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in this very nice and cozy hotel, very good location, we got a lot of assistant from the people working there like informations, where to go for nice dinner and booking of the most beautyfull show in town "Le Lido".

Reviews.Title: “the presonal and the clean of the hotel are very good!”
Reviews.Author: Pecchioli
Reviews.Content: The position of hotel was perfect for me, i stay only one night, and i was very good. i board this hotel at everything!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with the room you are placed in.”
Reviews.Author: VancouverElizabeth
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this Hotel twice. The first time was quite enjoyable with a modern room overlooking the front of the hotel. The second time was terrible. The room was small, dated and appeared to be in the attic overlooking a back alley.

Reviews.Title: “very small !”
Reviews.Author: AHolidayGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a quiet side street about 5 minutes walk from Opera. The location is excellent. I found the staff to be great. The hotel itself was nice, but if you are claustrophobic, they you should avoid it. My room was very tiny, in fact, the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen - and that's from a Londoner! The lift, well, it is so small, that only one person with luggage can use it at a time. The thing I did like was that I was staying in the same room that Oscar Wilde stayed in! Overall, this hotel is nice, but if you like spacious places, then you should avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, clean, comfortable, modest, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: xegete
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, clean room and comfortable bed, recently remodeled bathrooms, free wi-fi, ten-minute walk to the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay, about fifteen minutes to Notre Dame. Located on a quiet side-street with very little traffic noise. Small - only 28 rooms, and so none of the amenities you might expect in a large hotel (like restaurant, exercise room, etc. - but that's not a problem for me).

Reviews.Title: “L'hotel idéal”
Reviews.Author: fanfandoha
Reviews.Content: I just come back from a very great stay in Paris with my family. I spent so great time in this this place, that I would like to go again. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and will accomodate most of your reasonable requests. The location is very good and in a short walking distance to good restraurants and sightseeing locations. I Higly recommend this charming hotel for all travelers who want discover Paris in the best conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of expensive for what it offers...”
Reviews.Author: Kaori16
Reviews.Content: Staff was kind, room was clean and location was very good. Also free wi-fi was very useful. However, room, bathroom and elevator are really tiny. Toilet didn't work very well (you had to be very persistent to get rid off nr 2). Guess Oscar Wilde moved in when he really was out of pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favourite.......”
Reviews.Author: DeanoNorthPerth
Reviews.Content: .....but having said that, I much prefer staying in the 5th, 6th or 7th Arr.. However this time we had friends staying in the 1st and wanted to be near them. As such, I have very little to compare. However, I will list a few problems as I see them. The hotel offers 3 (I think) different sized rooms. We took the middle option. Glad we didn't take the smaller one as it was poky as was. This could be normal for this area however. I am also glad we didn't go for the largest room as, from peeking in when the cleaner was there, the larger room on our floor had the bedhead right against the wall with the elevator the other side. There would have been noise all night. In fact as we checked out a lady was at the desk asking to be moved. The only option offered to her was change hotels with a partial refund! We also had problems with the TV and telephone in the room. The TV was fixed the same night but the problem with the telephone (we could hear people on the other end but they could not hear us) was never resolved. The shower head also leaked. It worked ok but there was always water flooding out where the head connects to the hose. So in summary, think carefully about the size of room you request and perhaps be prepared for things not to be working correctly in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: SinatraFans
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay here and once again it was a great experience. The location is great, being 5 minutes walk from the Louvre, the Opera and the nearest Metro Station. Its also very quiet as it is in a small square just off the Rue De L'Opera. Yes the rooms are small but hey, this is what you expect in Paris unless you want to pay a fortune or stay in the suburbs. They are clean and comfortable and the bathroom actually has a bath! The staff are second to none and nothing is too much trouble for them. The breakfast is also good with cereals, cold meats, cheeses, yoghurts, fruit, boiled eggs, croissants etc. Hopefully we will be back in Paris soon and we will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Rosy083
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in Paris. The location is very good as one can walk to Opera and Louvre quite easily. The hotel is situation in a small road off main road an it was hard to find so make sure you get good directions before going. The rooms were small but very clean. There was a mini bar in the room for refreshments and the staff was very polite and cheerful. I would definitely stay there again. The prices are good and the location is very good! enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChiccaM
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 days, and it was just perfect. It was my second time at this hotel, and I got a very nice and cozy room on the 7th floor. Although the elevator only goes up to the 6th floor, it was no big drama to go up a few stairs. The room was small but very nice, super clean and I adored it. Air conditioning was working, and that was very helpful. will definitely go back there next time. The staff is always nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you are not at the 7th floor and enjoy it”
Reviews.Author: Ventin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera is a very good hotel for Paris standart. Very well located, with three metro lines two blocks far, and reasonable priced. Very tiny elevator. Just be sure you are not at the 7th floor, there's no elevator and the ceiling is less than 2 meters high.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pretty reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: homey123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in May 2010 and enjoyed the location equally distant from the Louvre and The Opera. Rooms were not huge and the en suite facilities were quite crammed but for 2 nights that was OK. Didn't partake of breakfast so can't comment. Staff at reception were very helpful and polite. Overall a reasonably priced hotel for Paris and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Irenedoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very central, between Grand Opera and Louvre, 5 min walk to 3 metro stations. The staff at reception is very welcoming and helpful. The room was tiny, but very convenient. The central location of the hotel and the price for it are the main advantages of the hotel. We came to the hotel just for a night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but good service and handy location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: jobriggs1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the end of a refurbishment - the bits that have been done like the breakfast room look very smart. Staff were very helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are tiny and quite dark and the lift is the smallest I have ever seen. But everything was very clean and the toiletries and tea/coffee facilities good. The self-service breakfast represents very good value, especially for Paris which is generally exhorbitant. The hotel is in a very quiet street and there is not a lot of life in the vicinity so if you want a bit of a buzz in the evening I would recommend staying in another area (Le Marais or the Latin Qtr). But the location is great for a first time visit to Paris as the Louvre is only a few mins walk, as is the start of L'Open Bus Tour.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: wildmecke
Reviews.Content: This is a minimalistic hotel. When we arrived, the hotel was undergoing renovation and appeared very uninviting. The elevator was so small it barely accommodated two people without luggage. The room itself was so tiny there was no place to place luggage without stepping over it. The ceiling was very low, and I had to stoop over to take a shower (I am 6 feet tall). The view from the window was a wall three feet away. As sparse as it was, the room was functional, well maintained, and kept clean. Breakfast which cost an additional 12 Euros, was very simple and not worth the money. Also, when we did not arrive early, we found the selection picked over and missing items were not replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Muy buen hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marducita
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general is small but nice. During my stay they were remodelating. It is very well located, near the Opera Garnier and 200 mts away from 3 metro stations, but I had the hardest time finding it when I arrived, because it's in a tiny street and sorrounded by diagonals, and all the streets in the area change names almost every block. So if you are planning to go there, bring a detailed map so you don't get lost. The elevator is extremely small but we had no problem since we were in the first floor, so we used the stairs. The room was nice, recently renovated, and I have to say that the matress was very nice, it wasn't bended in the middle like in most hotels (even good ones usually have that problem). You have a kettle in the room so you can have coffee or tea at any time. The bathroom also was nice, very modern and newly renovated, with air conditioning and a good, powerful and roomy shower. The rest of the bathroom was very small but it was fine. I really liked it. Towels were very white, thick and fluffy with very nice smell. The bedroom window had no view, only a grey wall, but the advantage was that I didn't hear a single noise in the night (or in the day either!). Since the hotel is in a small, hidden street, I think even the front rooms must be quiet. Also we had double door, so it was very sound proof. Breakfast was ok, the usual continental, bread, ham, cheese, butter, jam, fruit salad (not homemade), croissants, coffee, milk, juice, etc. Everything was tasty and very good. And very nice the lady who served it. The only thing missing was a lounge room or space, but I think it was because of the remodelation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday - great location , accomodation and staff”
Reviews.Author: LPDublin
Reviews.Content: Very central location , easy to walk to many of the top attractions or if we found it necessary to take the metro - plenty of stops nearby . Great character in the hotel - and breakfast was very good . Staff very welcoming and happy to assist with any requests for assistance - map reading , restaurants etc .

Reviews.Title: “easy and charming”
Reviews.Author: NicoChanut
Reviews.Content: A very charming hotel in the heart of Paris. Very close from Opera Garnier, the staff will take care of your stay. Do not hesitate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay their again!”
Reviews.Author: Jen12345OrlandoFL
Reviews.Content: I shared a triple with some friends on our first visit to Paris. Found the hotel to be in a great location. We took the bus from the airport and walked from the Opera House to the hotel (about 10 min walk) Staff was friendly, our room was nice and the bathroom clean and bright. Street was quiet, and walking distance to many attractions. For the price don't think twice just book this place. 3 women traveling together felt very safe and secure here.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TammyMoscow
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, small and cosy, with an ancient touch to the decor but with trendy design elements, unobtrusively yet so unmistakably French, with a most friendly staff who make you feel absolutely at home. My favourite place of stay for several years running. One can’t wish for a better vacation setting actually. Tamara Nekrasova

Reviews.Title: “it has cons and pros”
Reviews.Author: Olya_Ch
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in this hotel for few days. positive: very clean rooms, nice locations, reasonable stuff; negative: 1) rooms on the picture do not correspond to the actual size (we lived in the room what was a bit bigger than our bathroom at home), 2) wallpaper has bubbles in it, tile is cracked 3) it looks like that walls are made of cardboard as you can hear your neighbor going to bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Authentic experience”
Reviews.Author: megancGeelong
Reviews.Content: While this hotel was quite expensive, it did offer me an authentic Parisian experience. We stayed on the first floor and had windows that opened onto the street complete with a flower box. The small street was quite noisy with business activity mon-fri, but it was quiet on the weekends, you also could not hear anything when the window was shut. The location is great with metro, supermarket and attractions close by. The hotel staff were not overly friendly, and we got nothing more than hello and goodbye for the 8 days that we stayed there. While we didn't use the breakfast facilities, they didn't look very good and certainly not worth the price asked. The free internet was good, and they were happy to give us more at no extra charge when we used all the time initially allocated. All up we had a fantastic time and the hotel suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Almost an Hotel Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Rackam
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with great location in the heart of Paris, between the Opera end The Louvre;so close to famous dept stores, a few steps away from metro stations as well as a direct metro link to Disneyland Paris. The welcome in this hotel made us feel as an Hotel Boutique.

Reviews.Title: “No Airconditioning For Five Nights!”
Reviews.Author: mscrog
Reviews.Content: After extensive review, I chose this hotel. Overall, it is as advertised by the reviews on this site. At first, I thought I had found a great value. The room were small, but clean. The staff was friendly and spoke good English. The location on a quiet convenient square was good. The elevator, however, only holds one person and the beds are quite hard. The big problem for the Paris summer heat was NO Airconditioning. Each day, I was told it was to be fixed the next so I kept staying at the same hotel rather than moving. Finally, the last day they said it was going to be 3 weeks till it was fixed! I felt sorry for the people who were checking in when I was leaving. There were about 8 units out and there was no other rooms they could move me to. I tried to get a small discount on the bill ( would have asked for about 10%) from the manager to no avail. I was offerred a free breakfast or one day free on my next visit to Paris, but I think I will go ahead and upgrade to a place where I won't have to sweat all night next year! It makes a long day knowing you are going back to a sweat box at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean and comfortable Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GuatemalaMico
Reviews.Content: Staff was very corteous, very well located (close to Monoprix and very good Brasseries to eat). Very close by to the Opera, Galeries Laffayette and Au Printemps and beautiful Louvre. Pretty silent at night. We went there for nine days with my husband and 9yo daughter. Comfortable room to rest. Very close to nice Parisian attractions. Tottally recommend this Hotel. Family from Guatemala, Central America.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: travelfan023
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parent's as a 40th Wedding Anniversary gift. They had a fantastic time in Paris and found the hotel was spotless, and the staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel in a perfect location - right in the heart of Paris, but situated in a nice quiet spot. We went for the Large Double room reservation after reading reviews saying the rooms were very small. According to my parents the room they had was ideal. Wouldn't hesitate to book this again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home friendliness and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Pierre_28_28
Reviews.Content: With an excellent location, a short walk from the Roissy bus terminal & L'Opentour office, exceptionally helpful and friendly hotel staff and modern in- room facilities and appointments, this hotel would be hard to beat in central Paris for a home away from home short or long visit. A winner all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Set in a quiet square near the Opera”
Reviews.Author: SinatraFans
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous small hotel set halfway between the Louvre and the Opera. About 3 minutes walk takes you to both. The rooms are smallish but very clean and the bathroom had a bath which was a lovely surprise. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and were happy to help us with any queries we had. It is also in a lovely quiet square so there were no noise problems. We would definitly stay here again as it represents really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: Frozen_in_MN_USA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my son in a twin room. The biggest complaint is the size of the beds - the single beds are very small. I am generously guessing they are 30" x 6' (76 sm x 180 sm). That would've been OK, but the mattresses are also extremely firm. The room was small as described by others, but that was expected was the location and price. The bathroom is too small even for Paris. The elevator is tiny (2 persons or 150 kg=330 lb) with enough space for just two. The AC did not work one night, but was fixed the next day. The bottom line - you can find a centrally located bad hotel for less. On the other hand if you aspire to learn to sleep on nails, that's your hotel. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris at New Year 2008”
Reviews.Author: LondonDennis
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day New Year trip to Paris. We were a party of five, including two nieces, in their twenties, from Australia. The hotel was excellent; the rooms were of a good size for Paris. The staffs were very helpful and spoke excellent English. We had breakfast on day 2 which was good value for money. The location was ideal for many of the Paris sites to visit. I would recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Paris who wanted good value for money accommodation. The only downside was our disappointment with the lack of fireworks at midnight on New Years Eve; one of the main reasons we decided to visit Paris for New Year. However, this was no fault of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Bibine2
Reviews.Content: Excellent location at walking distance from Le Louvre and l'Opéra and very close to 3 metro station. Around the hotel you have a lot of very nice restaurants. Moreover its excellent location in a very quiet street , the staff is very helpfull and kind. In the room we very much appreciate the tea facilities The room was very clean as well as the bathroom. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AntipodeanVegetarian
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a nice position in an emerging hotspot - Japanese section of Paris. Easy to get to if you catch Roissybus from CDG Airport (5 minute walk). Intimate, classic interiors and very friendly and helpful staff who spoke excellent English. Close to two Metro stations, and close to the RER if you need to get to to Orly Airport. Easy walk to Tuillerie Gardens, major stores and boutique confectioners. Added bonus for me was the Oscar Wilde connection. Had a wonderful time and thanks again to the staff who were so helpful over the phone and in person. I look forward to returning next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Heidi-Ann
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the Louvre, and not right on a main street. It is situated on a small side street which really cuts down on the noise. The staff were all fluent in English, though I found most of the staff not to be too friendly. There was one fellow at reception that was quite helpful, though it would have been nice if they were all that way! The room we had at this hotel was EXTREMELY small. It was the smallest room I had stayed in anywhere. But you have to consider that it is an old hotel, and that is the way older hotels are. The elevator to get up to the room was also like stepping into a closet. Just enough room for you and your suitcase, and that is all. That aside, the rooms were very clean. The hotel offers internet access for a fee, and a continental breakfast which I didn't find too appealing. In a city that offers fine pastries, the hotel simply offers pre-packaged muffins, along with boiled egss, cereal, and whatever you like to put on toast. Overall, it was an average experience, but the location to the Louvre was great. If your focus is the Louvre, and you don't mind tiny rooms, then this hotel would probably suffice. The english speaking staff is also an added benefit if you don't speak french!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: teacher100
Reviews.Content: This is the third year in a row we have stayed at this hotel, It is so central to everything you need to see in Paris, and is situated in a quiet street but also close to 2 Metro stations. This time we decided to spend a little extra (15 euros a night) and requested a triple room overlooking the street. This gave us that little bit of extra room - we thought this was great value. The shower is so typical French, I don't understand why they all use such antiquated plumbing, but the bathroom and the rest were all spotlessly clean. The only other criticism was that they do not refresh the shampoo every day which is a nuisance if you don't bring your own. The staff are all caring and friendly - as well as speaking very good English. They go out of their way to be helpful. We did not pay for breakfast as there is a Paul's across the main road and a Starbuck's across the road where you can get a croissant and coffee for about 5 Euros.We will continue to use this hotel because it is value for money and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest bathroom ever”
Reviews.Author: afds
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, very central but on a quiet street. The staff is helpful, the room (I had a medium double) was OK, but the bathroom was the most uncomfortable one I've ever used. There was literally no room to turn around without hitting against the wall. I know rooms in Paris are small, and considering how much time one spends in the hotel it's not that important provided the bed's OK and the bathroom's OK. This bathroom would have been fine for a contortionist, but not for me, which is why I won't be going back, and I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera”
Reviews.Author: KBNewYork
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent staff. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: guitargal
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and read the reviews, then decided to stay there. My husband and I spent three nights, and found the hotel to be very comfortable and clean. The hotel staff was excellent and very helpful both before and during our stay (as I had many questions). We stayed on the third floor (room 303) and had a king bed. The lift only fits one person with luggage, but I knew that from reading the reviews and simply used the spiral staircase, which I found very quaint. The location was incredible. The hotel is close to three Metro stations, and is on a small, quiet street. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and we were able to walk pretty much everywhere. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: vosl
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris exhausted feeling as though we were on the holiday from hell but that all changed as soon as we stepped inside Louvre Marsollier. The rooms are small to tiny and the lift even smaller but the atmosphere and location were great., staff friendly and helpful. This all added to its charm. The rooms were warm and cosy (important when outside the fountains were frozen over!) not 4 star but very comfortable and clean. We arrived before checkin time but were given access to our 2 rooms immediately (We were travelling as a family of 5). The location was very central with 3 metro stations and an RER within easy walking distance. We used the metro at all hours and felt very safe getting back the short walk to the hotel. Nearby are cafes and patisseries which we frequented for breakfast but the hotel has a breakfast that looked very tasty. Whenever we return to Paris Louvre Marsollier is where we will stay. It just felt comfortable and a nice place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: david9498
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed here in June 06. We booked a quad room and a double room. The hotel is fantastically located near the Opera House and metro stops. Our rooms were fine, VERY QUIET, and comfortable. Breakfast room is a bit small but fine. The price of this hotel was a great value and the availability of a quad room was a real bonus as we did not have to rent 3 rooms for 6. Highly recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “would defenitely go back”
Reviews.Author: ann_tess
Reviews.Content: We booked this place for a 3 night stay and got a deal for that.. It was a little difficult to find the hotel.It is quite near the opera. We took the roissy bus from CDG. But once you reach the opera and start walking it can get quite confusing. The best thing would be to print out a map before setting out. The hotel was nice. The lift was tiny and can just fit in a suitcase and one person. The room was big enough for 2 people and had all facilities you would need. Also there is a metro station very nearby..The reception was helpful and they arranged us a taxi to the airport at 4 am in the morning. On the whole it was decent hotel and we would be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a real find in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Picu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the Oscar Wilde Suite. This suite comfortably fits four people and can accommodate up to five, though granted it would be crowded with a fifth person unless it was a small child. It has two separate bedrooms, which are connected, each with their own bathroom. One bedroom has a double bed and the other two twin beds. It was perfect for a family of four, which included two young adults, age 18 and 20. The hotel has only 28 rooms and the employees at the reception desk are friendly, speak English, and are always willing to provide help. The rooms were typical European (small), but had a small table with two chairs, a plasma TV, and WiFi access. Since we were not traveling without our computers, we used the hotel computer, which can be accessed for a fee. Breakfast, though it may seem expensive, (now at 12 euros a person) is actually a good deal, considering the prices in Paris. There are not many breakfast places nearby and the best we found was a Boulangerie about a block away for 5.5 euros. The difference is at the hotel is basically all you can eat. This hotel has a great location. It is within a block and a half ot the Quatre Septembre station and about three blocks from Opera. It is walking distance to the Louvre (about 10 minutes). I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good, affordable hotel to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera”
Reviews.Author: marilyns55
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel close to everything in Paris. The metro station was convenient and got us to all the sites in town. My husband and I enjoyed walking around the area and felt very safe. The room was very comfortable and always clean. The hotel staff was excellent. Nicolas and Pierre were very helpful when we had questions on how to get to places in Paris. They offered help with restaurants and booking side trips. I liked the fact that they spoke english as our french is not very good! We will definitly stay here again the next time we go to Paris. It really felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “As Good as it Gets”
Reviews.Author: jpklym
Reviews.Content: This cozy hotel is in an excellent location. We found the service to be impeccable. The staff is very friendly and willing to help make your stay in Paris an exceptional one. Our room was very comfortable and included a mini bar and an electric teapot, which we really enjoyed for making afternoon tea or coffee. Two metro stops are within five minutes of the hotel, which allow easy access to all of Paris. There is good shopping nearby, as well as excellent restaurants. The hotel offers continental breakfast each morning, which is very convenient. Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera is as charming as Paris herself. Thanks to all of you for making our stay so great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: AnnanTA
Reviews.Content: I took the smaller size room which was pretty small but adequate although bathroom was a bit cramped. Lift is really small, 2 people and their luggage were difficult to get in. Spiral stairs would be difficult for some people to negotiate. If that is not an issue, as it was not for myself, then I would recommend it as it was good for a Paris 3 star. it was really clean with fairly new furniture and furnishings. Staff were helpful and it is in a nice area as the name suggests. Try the indian restaurant next door, it is quite chique and the food is good although not as hot as you would expect in blighty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great triple room, excellent access to Metro”
Reviews.Author: ruthsillars
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with perfect triple room for three friends travelling together. The staff are genuinely helpful and although being close to the relatively expensive Opera area, there are some great little restaurants around. Right in between the two metro stations Pyramides and Quatre Septembre the hotel is perfectly placed in a quiet square round the corner. No complaints!! Great for a little weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: JanandSue
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location 5 mins Opera and 5 mins Louvre and great shopping close by. Very clean and nice sized room with a bath and a shower. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Nice selection of eating places close by. The street was quiet in comparison to a lot we saw and we felt very safe in this area. Easy access from CDG airport on Roissy bus, which only stops at the Opera, so no concern about where to get on or off. I would recommend this hotel and we hope to visit it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: rjalv
Reviews.Content: We're glad we chose the Louvre Marsollier Opera. It's central location is great, within walking distance to the Louvre and Notre Dame in one direction, and to the Madeleine, Opera and the main department stores and boutiques in the other direction. Two different Metro stations within 2 to 3 hundred meters makes it very convenient to connect to almost anywhere within minutes. There are several options for breakfast along the Opera Avenue, as well as for dinner all around and in the main avenues, like Capucines. Staff were polite and very helpful, always ready to answer our questions and offer advices when requested. The rooms are comfortable and well lighted, clean, but...small. But that's the same anywhere in Paris, unless you have big, loaded pockets. Overall: great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Yogadance
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, 3 tub stations are near by, shuttle bus station to CDG is within walking distance. Lots of Japanese restaurants are near by. There is a Monoprix(Fred Meyer) near by too. Triple room is quite large, but double is small. The only complaint I have is one nigh the hotel did not have hot water and overnight stuff did not do much other than a plain 'sorry'

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NY_Traveler00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! We took the Roissybus from Charles de Gaulle airport, which drops you off at the Opera, and it was an easy walk to the hotel. We booked a Large Triple room (even though there were just two of us). It was immaculate. It had a queen-sized bed, twin daybed/sofa, desk and two chairs, with a small balcony overlooking the Rue Marsollier. The bathroom had a bathtub, plenty of towels, hairdryer and nice toiletries. There was an electric tea kettle, coffee/teabags, and a minibar/fridge (which we used to store our own milk for tea). The location can't be beat - there are two metro stops just blocks away. The rue Marsollier is extremely quiet, even though it's very close to everything. The hotel desk staff spoke perfect English and couldn't have been nicer. The breakfast was served buffet style - it was delicious and quite substantial (including unlimited croissants/baguettes, cereal, fruit, meat & cheese). I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Paris and now I will always stay at the Hotel Louvre Marsollier.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfullly quaint,reasonable and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night mid August at a very good rate of 100Euros for a single occupancy of a a double bedded room. The hotel is charming and within a few minutes walk of the Opera Garnier,the Madeleine area...etc. In fact one can walk to practically anywhere it is so central. It is situated in a very quiet little enclave off the busy Avenue De L'Opera. I was on the 6th floor in a charming room with wooded beams and an exposed ancient brick wall with two windows and a state of the art air conditioner. It also posessed the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in my life,however everything worked and it was fine. Breakfast is an additional and very reasonable 10 Euros for the high quality and variety of foods from the buffet. The coffee was delicious. The biggest bonus however,was the helpful and courteous staff. The reception was manned by the deadpan but charming Nicholas while I was there, who was only too happy to make dinner reservations or help with directions to where one wanted to go. The ladies who tended the breakfast room and the cleaning of the rooms were all friendly and smiling. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient hotel with great and helpful people in reception”
Reviews.Author: StavN
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent and is very convenient because is situated in the centre of Paris and you can go around on foot and also you have a quick access to Underground stations like 'Opera', 'Quatre Septembre', 'Pyramides' and also to bus stops. The people in the reception are very kind, helpful and willing to assist you in any query you may have. The standard rooms were quite small but still very clean and were providing all necessary facilities e.g. TV, mini bar, safe box, wireless access to internet etc. The only "con" I can say about the hotel was that the elevator was very small just suitable for two people or one person with one luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Locaton - Great Hotel - Great Service - Great English”
Reviews.Author: avianmoon
Reviews.Content: We came here based on the recommendation of friends and they were right. This medium priced hotel is located on a quiet street, near the Louvre/d’Orsay/l’Orangerie museums and several tube stops of the wonderful Paris Metro “subway”. There are restaurants galore surrounding it – be sure to check out the “green mouse” near by. The hotel is well run by a friendly, helpful and attentive staff and the front desk personnel speak almost flawless English. For Paris, the rooms are a good value. In fact, the only thing preventing an “Excellent” rating is the Euro/Dollar exchange rate. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in best possible Paris location!!!”
Reviews.Author: SteketeeFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Louvre Marsolier Opera after reading about it here when it came up on a search. After going to the hotel site and seeing that it truly was right in the heart of everything I wanted to take my family to see, we booked. We were not disappointed -- nice quiet street just blocks from the Opera, Louvre, Seine Batobus, rue du Rivoli, everything. The rooms are typical European, meaning they are small, but very well appointed, clean, great bathrooms. The staff was exceptional -- my daughters especially felt comfortable which is a real bonus. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Seasoned travelers are well pleased.”
Reviews.Author: EDGE_of_America
Reviews.Content: We travel to France on average twice a year on mixed business and pleasure. We work in the central of France but for our stay in Paris it is always a shot in the dark as far as hotels are concerned. Having now discovered Hotel Louvre Marsollier we are now very happy to make Paris a stop over. The hotel is in an excellent location but yet quiet and very comfortable to stay. We are especially concerned about the quality of air-conditioning in the summer and are well pleased with the effency of the rooms at this hotel. The hotel is within a block of everything one would want from good resturants at sensible prices to the Metro subway and top end shopping. Also with the hotel being located in a somewhat residential area there are many many shops with goods at prices for the "locals". Even the TV has some english speaking channels. After 8 years of stays in Paris we couldn't be happier to book again this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2shop
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our European adventure. The Louvre Marsollier was perfect for our 6 wonderful nights. Booked this hotel through Venere and got the large room we asked for. Our room (#202), as well as the hotel, is kept impeccably clean every day. We had a small fridge, a kettle and tea cups and everything we needed to make tea. Nice touch! The bathroom is a bit small, with tub and shower, but more than adequate. The towels and sheets are changed everyday. The Louvre Marsollier is located on quiet side street and is centrally located to many of the major sites (Louvre, Opera, Place Concorde, etc.). The staff is very friendly, attentive and helpful. Breakfast is served in a cute breakfast room next to the reception area and was served between 7:30 and 9:30. The selection is limited, but it does start your day off, and was sufficient for us: excellent coffee, fresh croissants and baguettes, cheeses, meats, etc. 10 euros is a bit steep but same price as everywhere else. While we were getting ready in the morning, my husband would go downstairs and fill our coffee cups which we brought from home. We just love our coffee!! We will definitely stay at this hotel for our next trip to Paris. Robin and Marie-France Montréal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Detken
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over easter weekend. The hotel is very well located an with in easy walking distance to the major sites (Champs Elysees, Louvre, Opera etc). The room was small, but hey this is Paris and about the norm given the price / location. Simple two person lift, no bar, a small breakfast area in the lobby (ok food and enough of it). Away from main roads hidden in a small square so quiet at night (no traffic noise). Good access to Opera Metro Station. Good tourist hotel for a couple of nights - very central

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: boys5
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel for my wife and I, and 3 of our sons 14,12,9 was not easy (unless we wanted to pay a fortune). Luckily we found the Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera. The Oscar Wilder suite was the perfect option. For 300 Euros a night we had 2 nice clean rooms with a double and 3 single beds. Two of the beds were in a connected room - making this a suite. Not huge but plenty big enough. Area was also quiet for sleeping at night. A bathroom with shower in both rooms! The hotel was very accomadating and gave us the option of serveral different configurations. Like others said there were nearby bakeries which were perfect for breakfast. Short walk to the Opera area and not much further to the Louvre, which you would also jump on a bus if you were tired. It was a good location for doing the regular tourist sites. No complaints on anything! Great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service!”
Reviews.Author: Facchinettix
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel, and all we can say: Don't hesitate - book! (just one thing: if you're nonsmoker as we are, don't forget to mention that in advance. We first got a smoker room, but by chance the hotel wasn't fully booked and we were able to swap to another room)

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated the stay”
Reviews.Author: Putuhepa
Reviews.Content: I wasn´t expecting much considering travellers reviews about hotels in Paris. In fact they wouldn´t reach american standards. However, the Louvre Marsollier Opera is amazingly located, on a silent small street nearby lots of touristics spots. The room was good-sized, confortable and equipped with mini-bar, ar-conditioning, TV with few choices of channel (mostly in french), safe (for which I believe I paid extra money) and a convenient bathroom. We didn´t try the breakfast. There´s a Starbucks a few blocks away. Complaints: few channels on TV, tiny little elevator (but at least the hotel had a working lift that serviced all floors), they didn´t replaced soaps, shampoos and stuff. You better take your own. All in all, a pleasant stay for a fair amount of money. I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Fantastic Location.”
Reviews.Author: blondiebee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel direct through the website after checking all the usual booking sites. I was able to book with the 'promotional' rate, which save us over £100! (The promotional rate, meant free breakfast and a discount, but it meant that if you didnt turn up or cancelled within 24 hours you would have to pay a small charge, which did'nt seem a problem and was definately worth it). We arrived in Paris and we did struggle to find the hotel, but thats part of the adventure and we saw lots of little back streets which we would never have seen. Arrived at the hotel to a warm welcome from the staff. The hotel is very small and quaint. The room (104), was on the first floor and yes it was very small, but immaculate and had a bath and shower. There were two very small wardrobes, which was enough for a 3 night stay, a safety deposit box (3 euros a night). Clean towels and bedding 'every' day. Breakfast is a self serve buffet, continental, croissants, eggs, toast, coffee, cakes, orange, etc and as much as you wanted. Its also served 7am - 10am which is good. There was no tea/coffee in the room, but I asked a couple of times for coffee at reception and they popped into the kitchen and made me some to take to the room. Even at 2am! The staff were very helpful and even managed to get us tickets to the Moulon Rouge when we failed to get any from a number of sources. They even got us a free river cruise! They also organised a taxi to the train station at 6.30am when we were leaving for the airport and gave us coffee before we left. The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from Le Louvre and near the metro station on a lovely quiet road. Very safe. I would definately stay here again, it was value for money and perfect for city sight seeing because your not in the room that much, so the size of the room was not an issue at all. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Paris helped by an interesting time at Louvre Marsollier Opera”
Reviews.Author: Mike02
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews for Louvre Marsollier Opera on Trip Advisor. The comments were right about the size of the rooms. When we first entered the room I was surprised that they were very small, however after a chat with the staff we were allocated a larger room for the next 5 nights for a small increase in the room charge. The rooms were clean, the staff were very helpful and gave us great advice and the hotel was close to the metro and places to eat. I would suggest that they fixed the directions to the hotel on their website as the hotel is behind the exit from the metro. We would recommend the hotel to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Can Do Better for This Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is tucked in the back streets, not far from the Opera House, Metro Stations, The Louvre, many restaurants, etc. You cannot underestimate how helpful it is to be located so close to so many sights. Previous reviewers have covered the size of the rooms, breakfast areas, and elevator. They are right, but this is Paris and you have to expect small bathrooms, down-sized beds and other inconveniences. This is not a bad hotel - it just doesn't give you a reason to come back. With so many three star hotels in this neighborhood, you could probably find something better. The Ascot Opera Hotel, just across the street seemed like a nicer property. Breakfast at 10 euros is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am just back from my trip in Paris. I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera. This is a charming hotel, very clean and close to everything. Rooms are quite large compared to the other parisian hotels I had already visited. The staff is so kind and so efficient (special thanks to Nicolas and Pierre) !

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, Good Pics”
Reviews.Author: Denver_KS
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera must have had a good photographer. I have stayed in the typical small Paris hotel room. No problem, in Paris you aren't staying in the room much anyway. These rooms looked nice on the website and the descriptions sounded nice. However, the room was so small I didn't have room for my suitcase anywhere except the bed. I was felt like my head was going to hit the ceiling. The carpet hadn't seen a vacuum in ages. Definately, a do not book.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Louvre Marsollier Opera
HotelInfo.Address: 13, rue Marsollier | 2nd Arr., 75002 Paris, France
